IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. To complete some important improvement works, we'll need to temporarily turn off your power. During this time, we'll be removing and installing a new electricity pole, diverting a high-voltage cable, and installing a new underground electricity cable to support future connections. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. To complete the work safely, we need to turn your power off to upgrade the equipment. To ensure the power is off for the shortest possible time, our engineers may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. This work is taking place on and around Gallows Green Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Following a customers request, we are diverting a 11 kv cable that is running along side the A47, this is to allow for future expansion of a dual carriageway. Once this work has been completed this will strengthen our electricity network and ensure the quality of supply. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we connect the new equipment and complete the work safely. To connect and disconnect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place on Ringland Road.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by LV Flickering Supply affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 28-JAN-2026 17:30.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 12:30. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Aaron at 02:15 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired the underground network fault in the Leathwell Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Aaron at 01:24
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Aaron at 23:38 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. If you're worried about an elderly or ill person in your property who is affected by the power cut today, we are able to provide some support. For more information just click here: https://bit.ly/40quttu If you have any further concerns or questions though, don't hesitate to call us free on 08003163105. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

MainMessage: We are aware of an incident caused by 11kV UG Fault affecting the electricity supply in your area. Our engineers are dealing with this and we estimate that most supplies will be restored by 27-JAN-2026 00:00.  Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message:
Great news - Our engineers have now restored power to all 48 customers in the SG19 3 area by removing a tree from the overhead network.

Thank you for your patience while our team worked hard to resolve the issue safely. We apologise the outage lasted longer than anticipated and we appreciate your understanding.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by Theo at 13:35
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 12:40 - Hi David here again. I just wanted to give you the latest update.

Our engineers have let us know that they have found a tree that has damaged our overhead cables which we need to remove and restore to be able to restore your power.  To give them time to do this safely, the estimated time frame to restore your power is now between 14:00 and 15:00.

We're sorry this is taking longer than expected, and we'll continue to keep you up to date, but if any change to this time comes in from our staff I'll let you know as soon as we hear.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 12:08 - Hi David here from the messaging team. I'm so sorry that power has gone off again today. I just wanted to let you know. Our engineers have advised that they have found trees laying on the overhead electrical cables in the SG19 3 area which they need to remove to be able to restore the power. At the moment we don't need to change thee estimated timeframe. We're sorry for the disruption this power cut may be causing. If you're worried about elderly or ill neighbours, we can offer help and support to our vulnerable customers during a power cut. Find out more here: https://bit.ly/40quttu. If you have any concerns, please call us on 08003163105
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Sent by Talie at 02:58 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Vaughan Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected underground cable fault, which our engineers have diverted power around.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry we've not been able to restore your power yet. We appreciate it can be unsettling to have a power cut during the night, but our engineers work 24 hours on issues like this so we're still aiming to have power restored as soon as possible.

If you light candles, please be mindful of them and take extra care when using the stairs. If you have any concerns, please call us on 105 and our team will help. We'll keep you updated. Sent by Talie at 01:40
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Adam at 02:20 - We can now confirm that all power in the Eastchurch and Sheerness, ME12 area should be back on. Our engineers have diverted power. However, due to the location and complexity of the issue, we have also used a temporary generator to restore power to the last of the affected properties. This will provide power until our engineers plan in and safely complete the full repair, which may take a few days.

We're really sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused. If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Adam at 02:00 - Hi - thanks for bearing with us, I know a power cut can be very disruptive. We've had an update from our staff that there are now 20 properties still affected by the faulty overhead network equipment, as they have managed to safely divert some power, getting the lights back on for 923 of our customers. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
We're sorry your power has gone off again today. We believed all power was restored but it seems there may be a bigger underlying issue which is causing our substation equipment to operate repeatedly.

Our engineers are still on site and using an average time frame, we are aiming to have all power back on between 16:30 and 17:30. We'll keep you updated with all of our progress.. Sent by Simon at 13:25.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 12:17 - We can now confirm that all power in the Avenons Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Sent by David at 08:50 - Hi David here again. We can now confirm that all power in the  Batts Lane area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 08:38 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 08:30 - Hi David here from the messaging team. I'm sorry power is off this morning. I just want to let you know. Our engineers have advised that they are estimating to have power restored between 13:30-14:30, but this could change depending on how investigations go.

We're sorry for the disruption this power cut will be causing, especially the impact it will be having on the start to your day. If you have any concerns about this please do not hesitate to contact our Customer Services team any time.

We will work to fix the problem as quickly and safely as possible.

Sent by David at 09:52 - Hi David here again. We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 547 customers in the Old Hall Park area by diverting power around a faulted piece of overhead network equipment. We're pleased that we have been able to restore power sooner than we estimated.

If your power isn't back on, we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.

Steps.Message: Sent by David at 09:44 - We're sorry for the disruption to your power today, especially for those who may be more vulnerable without the electric. We'll continue to keep you updated with our engineer's progress.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 10:36 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Strandfield Close area should now be back on.

I'm sorry for the continued disruption recently. We believe there may be a fault on our underground electricity cabling in the area, but currently it has not developed to a stage that our staff can pinpoint it. Their tests have proven inconclusive, so for now they have replaced our safety equipment at the substation to get your power back on as quickly as possible.

This may happen again before we're able to fix it, but if you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 09:32 - Our staff are on the way to the Strandfield Close area, and our estimated time frame to have power back on is currently between 12:30 and 13:30. However, this could change once our staff have assessed the local network.

We believe the power cuts you have been experiencing are caused by a fault with one of the cables. Developing faults can start very small, and so can be hard to detect but each power cut usually makes it easier to see, which means our specialist staff can detect it, and work on the repair to prevent further outages.

I'll let you know once our teams arrive.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Simon at 09:53 - We believe our engineers have been able to restore power to all 329 customers in the London SW1Y area, by diverting power around an underground cable fault. This means we have been able to restore power sooner than we anticipated, we're sorry for any disruption or worry this unplanned power cut caused you.   

If your power isn't back on we'll need to hear from you. To report this, or to talk to us about anything else, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

We know that being without power can be worrying, but please rest assured that our staff work around the clock to keep the lights on. If you have any concerns or questions, give us a call any time.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Simon at 09:31 - Our engineers are on their way. We believe the issue is an underground network fault that initially interrupted power to 329 properties. However, we have managed to divert power back to some properties, so 9 properties are still affected. Specialist engineers from our control room will continue to divert power remotely, so your power may come back on at any point. Sometimes we can't restore everyone this way, so we're also sending staff to check our equipment. We're currently estimating power will be on between 10:30-11:30, but this may change depending on what our staff find. Power back on? To stop receiving texts, follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe. Otherwise, we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage affects multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you expect. We're arranging staff to attend ASAP, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting electricity. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to get as many customers back on as we can.

Once available, our engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, they will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will work to locate the issue and make repairs, which may take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing but we'll always give you the clearest information we have.
